data.title: Nice Drinking Spot Open Air
data.text: Nice spot to grab an evening drink or just hang out.  Be aware though it is very casual and beer is the primary focus.  The bathrooms are outside and down a hallway so very casual again.

data.title: Great selection of beers and awesome pub food!
data.text: If you are looking for a huge selection of beers (on tap plus over 350 bottled varieties), ales and great food then this is the place to go to in SoCal. The kitchen offers daily specials and we tried one of those specials -- a burger which was 1/3 chuck, 1/3 brisket and 1/3 short ribs and it was absolutely delicious -- one of the best burgers I've had in a long time. We also tried a number of items of their regular menu (mainly starters) and they were all good. Their staff was great and helped us pair drinks with our taste preferences and food. It's a small location but definitely worth the trip.

data.title: Wow...great mac n chesse
data.text: Heard this was the #1 hamburger in Encinitas and one of the top 30 in San Diego County...and they were right! We got the garlic burger and it was so good! We also got the garlic fries! Also got mac n cheese with bacon...ohhh so good!

data.title: Best Burgers, Fries & Draft Beer in So Cal
data.text:
We stopped in here for a late lunch one day based on some online recommendations and they were all spot on !!  

The selection of draft beers is phenomenal and the bartender was exceptional at making recommendations based on my taste desires.  

The burgers...they are huge, and tasty !  I'd say they are one of the best I've ever had.  and the house special fries with blue cheese crumbs and bacon mixed in with them..WOW they were amazing !  the bacon was nice and crispy and what can i say except everything goes with bacon :)  

Other than the fact that they don't have AC, its a great place and we will return the next time we are So Cal.

data.title: Godd, decent food, GREAT selections of beer in bottles /bonus tap beer
data.text:
Had a very nice meal and tasted lots of beer here recently.

I enjoyed a flight of 4 tasters (4oz each) along with another two tasters.  The flight is brought out with a "cheat sheet" and you are given the location of each beer. I had fun--except for the dang IPA. I must've been misunderstood--I really do not like IPAs!--but I tasted half of it.. . .don't want to waste too much beer.

Food was good.  Onion rings were piping hot and delicious.  Burger was fine.  Husband's fish, shrimp and chips looked great.  He had a British brown ale and it was very tasty.

Service is slow here, but with as many beers as they have, well, you better get to tasting and drinking. Service was friendly and competent.

Tip: order your food first, have your server take it back and return to you for your beer order.

This was our second trip here and it was better than the first. Bring a designated driver or be prepared to Uber so you can really enjoy all the brews. It is a friendly feeling place.  There are tall bar-style tables and chairs up front close to the street and regular tables and chairs in the back.  I am told that the back can be stuffy, so sit up front if stuffy bothers you.

Recommended, and we will visit again.  I was very pleased with our outing here.

data.title: Great selection of craft and classic beers
data.text: We all had a different beer, from German to local brews. The Ale House is popular and gets  busy in the evening. We went a tad early, around 5:30 top beat the evening rush.

data.title: Cozy, Great beer selection.
data.text: Love this place.  Huge beer selection and usually there a theme beer or brewery offering something unique.  Burgers are awesome, the mac n' cheese pizza with siracha is a favorite to share with the table.  The place is cosy, and usually busy so it's not quiet, but once you get your spot to hunker down at, it's comfortable.  Servers are always nice, but you do get typical beach town service.  Just relax, the beers are coming and the food will get to you when its ready.  Enjoy.

data.title: The Best Beer & Burgers
data.text:
The Encinitas Ale House is a hub for beer lovers in North County. The beer list is extensive, with probably about 20 on tap (ever-rotating) and hundreds more in bottles -- both domestic and international. There's no doubt their menu has something to satisfy every beer drinker.

The Encinitas Ale House isn't just a bar that does food as an afterthought. Everything on the menu is excellent. I've only ever had burgers (I've probably had all of them) and each of them is delicious. I especially like the Santana Burger (but be prepared, because it may be too spicy for some) and the Harmonica Bill Burger. Don't forget to ask about the specials (or check the board), because they always have at least one exotic burger (camel, for example).

It's a pretty tiny place, but it's always worth the wait.

data.title: One of the first and still going strong!
data.text: The Encinitas Ale House was one of the first of its kind in the area back before there was much of a brew-pub scene.  20 or so taps of beers you don't normally see on anywhere else as well as Delirium Tremin!!  Beers rotate pretty quickly so there is always something new to try.  They have an 80 beers in 80 days club that if you complete you're name goes on the wall and you are entered into a drawing for some pretty cool trip.  The owner has taken people all over the world on beer inspired event as a thank you to the 80-ers.  Food is great too.  Always an exotic meat available for the adventurous burger eaters as well as standard fare.  If you're in the hood its worth a stop in.  It is a smaller venue and can get busy and the place seems to have quite a following.

data.title: Dave's Fries
data.text: The Encinitas Ale House is one of our favorite restaurants in Encinitas. They have a special Sweet Potato Fries called Dave's Fries. They add bacon and a creamy hot sauce with blue cheese to the Fries. It is delicious. Yesterday I also had their Surf and Turf Burger, but you can substitute a crab cake for the burger and it comes with jumbo shrimp on a nice bun. It was fantastic. Great atmosphere too.

data.title: Beer Lover’s Haven on South Coast Highway 101
data.text: The cozy Encinitas Ale House on South Coast Highway 101 in Encinitas is a must visit for beer lovers in San Diego and beyond. There’s a fantastic selection of both craft San Diego and international brews to choose from. Plus got to love the pink elephant and taps hanging from the ceiling.

data.title: Dinner with friends
data.text: We stumbled upon this spot while waiting on a table for another, in-named restaurant, and were pleasantly surprised. The service was great, the price was good, the food was just what we wanted. Overall, a great evening. The only drawback was there was no AC so it was a bit warm inside.

data.title: Beer + Burgers
data.text: Went here on a calm but very hot n' humid weekday night. Be warned there is no A/C but that was forgotten soon after our drinks arrived. The staff was very nice and helpful with recommending local brew. Burgers were recommended so I went for the garlic burg and friend had the Harmonica Bill burg (an harmonica). Garlic burg was great! But it's not for the faint of heart, big chunks of sautéed garlic on this fella. Would definitely go back if we vacation here again.

data.title: Hole in the wall with amazing burgers and beer
data.text: It doesn't look like much from the outside, but this is a hidden gem. The burgers is juicy and amazingly tasty, and the beer selection is amazing in a place with excellent beers everywhere.

data.title: Lots to pick from
data.text:
Between their beers and food menu, there's lots to pick from. Went last week for beer and dinner. While there were out of a couple of beers I wanted, there were still plenty to pick from. We had the Kobi burger and Mac n cheese. Both were great. My 2 complaints are the burger was perfectly done in the middle but overdone around the edges and I upgraded to the garlic fries and they weren't done enough, not worth the extra couple of dollars. 
Overall it's a fun little place with lots of character.

data.title: Great little bar and Restaurant
data.text: There are a lot of beer places in San Diego county, but this small little bar was a great surprise. Encinitas Ale House had a great local beer selection on draft, and lots of great bottled beers. We had beers from new microbreweries that were quite good, and the food menu provided some tasty small dishes to accompany the beers. They tried to provide different things that other bars don't have, but that were really good. And, the Kobe beef sliders was quite good, and went well with the beers. I would definitely go back here.

data.title: Best beer selection in Encinitas
data.text:
Stopped here on our first night in Encinitas. Read about it in Draft Magazine. Was crowded, but decided to wait, and had a beer. Huge selection of beers from all over the country. Checked out the menu, has typical bar food, burgers looked good, but we decided to try the chicken tacos.
Good move on our part. Large potions, with just the right spice. 
Good place to try, as everyone is friendly.

data.title: They've Got Pliny
data.text:
My wife and I had thought about eating here two nights earlier, but it was a Friday and so the place was quite crowded.  This time around, mid Sunday afternoon, the Ale House was busy in a nice way, and after sitting down and examining the beer list we were glad we came.  Among their many offerings was the long sought after but rarely encountered Pliny the Elder.  I found it interesting that the two places I’ve found this fine brew outside of its home city of Santa Rosa was here in San Diego County.  

We split an order of the daily special crab cakes, which were so spicy hot that we could barely get through them, as good as they were and an order of the fish and shrimp and chips.  The portion sizes were large, more than enough to satisfy the both of us.  All of this was reasonably priced, again a surprise given the touristy beachy nature of the place.

data.title: Unbelievable happy hour!  Huge portions that don't skip on quality!
data.text: We ate here twice during our recent visit in San Diego.  They have an incredible selection of beers on tap, including the hard to find Pliny.  Portions are enormous, but at happy hour, all apps are half price.   The sliders app has three big burgers and was enough to feed my three kids.  We will definitely come again when in the San Diego area!

data.title: Great Burgers and Beer
data.text:
Great burgers (grass fed cattle)  and huge selection of great beer! 
Definitely busy on the weekends, worth the wait. Also have another burger place in La Jolla called The Public House.
